alert.note: Alert for Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 12 at 3:37AM MDT until October 12 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Generally 4 to 8 inches expected above 8,000 feet. Totals around 12 inches across the highest terrain in the Tetons. * WHERE...Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MDT today. The heaviest snow will fall this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact travel over Teton and Togwotee passes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hunters and others heading into the backcountry should prepare for wet and cold conditions. Wet snow could make for difficult travel on unpaved mountain roads, especially above 8,000 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
